hero.name: Jeremiah
hero.info: I am a front end developer

about.title: A bit about me
body: Hi, I'm Jeremiah—a front-end web developer passionate about transforming ideas into seamless, visually engaging digital experiences.

I thrive on the intersection of creativity and precision, taking pride in crafting intuitive designs and writing clean, efficient code. With a strong foundation in both front-end and back-end technologies, I enjoy solving complex challenges and delivering thoughtful, effective solutions.
For me, each project is an opportunity to combine technical expertise with a creative vision, building user experiences that are as functional as they are visually captivating.

objectives: Designed and implemented the user interface for a B2B client dashboard, focusing on delivering progressive and effective solutions for cutting-edge technology and data delivery.
Actively participated in ideation sessions to contribute to innovative user interface solutions.
Developed secured, high-availability, scalable web applications.
Developed responsive web designs for clients, ensuring compatibility across multiple browsers, devices, and platforms.
Efficiently delivered client requests within established timelines.
Created static sites using HTML, SCSS, JavaScript, and jQuery for a private healthcare company and a local esthetician.
Coached and motivated team members to provide exceptional customer experiences.
Developed and executed business plans to achieve regional, store, and employment targets.
Responsible for recruiting, training, and developing team members.

projects.name: Newty
details: Focus timer based on the Pomodoro Technique, built using NextJS with Chakra UI, and Redux for state management.
Encourages effective time management and productivity.

projects.name: Through the Woods
details: Personal blog app tracking and highlighting discovered hikes across Canada.
Built using NextJS, Chakra UI, Strapi CMS backend with MongoDB, and Cloudinary.
Authorized users can create, read, update, and delete trail entries.

projects.name: Experience Rally
details: Front-end focused ecommerce-based website built with create-react-app, styled with SCSS, and animations from Framer Motion.
Offers three subscription services for live rally races, featuring a hero page, subscription page, checkout page, and confirmation page.

projects.name: Homepage
details: Personal homepage built using GatsbyJS static site generator for ReactJS, styled with SCSS.
Features dynamic elements like personalized greeting, weather information, and random quotes.
Retrieves data using Openweather API and Random quote generator API.

projects.name: Newty
projects.details: Introducing Newty, an efficient focus timer based on the Pomodoro Technique, a time management method that helps you work with time, not against it. Boost your productivity by breaking work into focused intervals, each followed by a restorative break. This approach supports a balanced workflow, helping you stay focused and work more efficiently throughout the day.

projects.name: Portfolio
projects.details: A comprehensive showcase highlighting my expertise in ReactJS, NextJS, and Chakra UI, featuring a range of projects—from dynamic e-commerce platforms to custom homepages. This portfolio emphasizes my focus on blending design and functionality, demonstrating my problem-solving skills and commitment to user-centered development.

projects.name: Through the Woods
projects.details: Explore my personal blog app, designed to track and showcase trails with detailed information. This full-stack application offers a complete CRUD experience, allowing authorized users to effortlessly create, update, and delete trail entries. Built with NextJS and Chakra UI on the front end, and powered by a Strapi CMS backend with MongoDB and Cloudinary, this project highlights the seamless integration of innovative technologies and practical functionality.

projects.name: Experience Rally
projects.details: Experience the thrill of rally racing with Experience Rally, a subscription-based platform offering three distinct plans for live rally events. This is a demonstration of how a subscription-based platform can effectively combine immersive content, detailed subscription packages, and a smooth checkout process. Explore the engaging hero page, discover the available plans, and enjoy a user-friendly experience. This dynamic web platform showcases the seamless integration of information, subscription options, and checkout functionality.

projects.name: Homepage
projects.details: Discover a personalized experience with the Homepage project, a custom homepage that features a dynamic background, a random quote generator, current weather updates, personalized greetings, and real-time time and date displays. Powered by the OpenWeather API and a Random Quote Generator API, this project seamlessly blends aesthetics with live, interactive content, offering an engaging and dynamic user experience.
